column4: QUESTION: In System ->Preferences -> Sessions, what is the command to have the network manager start up? Thanks!
there's an additional parameter - hang on
What does the 2nd part do? Is it defualt?
it's default , and I have no idea :)
looks like "session manage disable " or something
Alright, can hardly go wrong with the default.
well, I seem to recall doing it without --sm-disable and that worked OK, so try noth if one doesn't work
Alright. Ubuntu Studio did not have anything for the NM! So I forgot what the command was.
Can i start the applet from alt+f2?
I don't know - just do this in gnome-terminal :  nm-applet --sm-disable & disown %1
if nm-applet doesn't pop up, run  sudo /etc/init.d/dbus restart
actually, i found out I don't have NM installed. :) Thanks for your help anyways!
well, having it installed would help, yeah ;p
